values: Who is the selfish one when someone asks you to give up what you need most for the thing they want most?

It's been... a little while.  Things have changed in every possible way.

I'm living in Colorado now.  I'm not sure I like it better.  Well, I like the small town better than the big city.  I do not like the weather better and I do not like the people better.  I have a great paying job and the hours aren't bad.  However, I work with the biggest bitch I've ever encountered.  She bad mouthes me behind my back unprovoked, speaks to me as if I'm a child, thinks she is God's gift to rural Colorado, looks at my images in the machine's hard drive when I'm not there, and refuses to be thankful for all of the help I give her.  And then, after all of that, has the nerve to ask me if I'll pick up weekend shifts for her.  Ya right, bitchface.  She's miserably unhappy and takes it out on me. 

But yay for a sign on bonus!  Yay for getting $5 more an hour!  Yay for only working four days a week!  Yay for it being a small hospital that isn't very busy at all.  Yay for health insurance!  Yay for them covering all of our moving expenses!  Yay for an "economic" temporary pay boost to cover some fuel costs.  Most of all, yay for management liking me and knowing that the other chick is a super bitch.

There are bad points though... I can't make it to Amanda's wedding, Sarah's wedding, or the XF: I Want to Believe premiere in Albuquerque with all of my Phile Phriends.  I feel horrid about all of these things.  I'm so sorry.

Our house in Albuquerque sold and closes on Wednesday.  Kelli will be in Colorado beginning Thursday and we're going to put an offer in on a house on Friday!  That means, hopefully, we'll have a house by the end of June!  I've been staying in a furnished apartment that is the top floor of an ancient farmhouse.  The angles are very unique!

I went home the first week of May to see my brother.  He was on leave from the USAF in Alaska.  I had a blast hanging out with him!  It was too bad I didn't have access to a vehicle because I wanted to see so many people and didn't get to do it.

Hope all is well with everyone!  I miss you.

Funny you should ask.

The Bad
  • I didn't get the dream job in Colorado.  They don't think I'll "mesh" well with their "team."  Whatever.  Fuck them.  They obviously don't know me!
  • My brother got a new commander a week ago and he said that now wasn't a good time for Alex to take leave (don't worry about the fact that we've spent a cumulative of over $2,000 on all of this, no no).  So... I'm not in Michigan right now like I'm supposed to be.  Looks like I'll be coming home in May!
  • Someone got ahold of my bank card information and racked up over $1,000 in expenses!   JOY!

The Good
  • I got two bonuses last week at work!  Dr Reddy was one of ABQ's top doctors again this year and he gave us all $500.  It turns out that I'm a nice person, so one of our outside facilities called into Reddy and complimented me so he paid the taxes on my call check.  Wee.
  • There is another place I can apply just outside of Montrose, CO for an ultrasound position.  Yay!  They have an opening!
  • I have this whole week off because they scheduled like I wouldn't be there for a week!  So here I am... puttering around!  Warcraft, movies, food and naps! 
  • I'm leaving for a massage right now!  CYA!

Photobucket Album
I could not get the picture to just load in the window so here are the trees...

Thus far December in New Mexico has been like early autumn in Michigan.  It took until Thanksgiving for the leaves to even decide to change colours.  We put up the Christmas treeS last weekend and finished painting over everything in the kitchen/living area.



Hair was redyed today... always fun!

I *****************FINALLY******************** got health insurance.  Hurray.  Now for a whole slew of appointments.

I survived my first night on call last Monday.  I hate the fact that I have to now do it every Monday until I leave that job but oh well, it pays great.

It has come down to this: If I can find a job in Colorado I may go, too.  If not... looks like back to Michigan with me.  I'd better fucking find a job.

Work has sucked me in and wholly consumed me.  I've fallen into the weekly routine that all people must, eventually.  It makes me feel old... and yet... not so old at all. 

So.. my roommate/housemate is moving in the spring.  I have no idea what will become of me, and this worries me greatly.  If she doesn't invite me to come with her (which I wouldn't blame her in the least for not) it is quite possible that I'd have to crawl back home with my tail between my legs.  I don't want to do that.  That is exactly the thing I do not want to happen.  I think that even if I saved every cent I earn between now and then I won't have enough to put a down payment on a place I'd enjoy owning.

Today I was paid the best compliments of my life.  While I still feel that I don't deserve any of them (or qualify for any of them), I can't help but smile.  "(You are) Intelligent, funny, intensely sexy, and yet vulnerable in ways that only seem to make you that much more compelling." 
Note to self: Date only well versed men.

Off to Outback Steakhouse for the salad I've been craving for months.

It starts this weekend!  My mother and aunt are getting here tomorrow.  It's going to be a great weekend!  Balloons, cliff dwellings, great views, birthdays and awesome food!  What's not to look forward to?  Plus time off of work never hurts.  

I promise pictures.

"Dad?"
    "Ya?"
    "This is going to be a stupid question."  I was already beginning to cry.
    "No, it won't."  He knew what I was going to ask.
    I could not say it.  I just let myself cry.  I felt his hand on my knee as he pulled the truck over to the side of the road.  We just sat there like that for a few moments.  Finally, I fathered enough courage to voice my question.  Very quietly I stammered, "Are you and mum getting a divorce?"
    He turned and looked me straight in the eyes.  He too began to cry.  "Yes."
    I lunged toward teh outside of the truck, throwing my body forcefully into the door.  Burying my face into my arms and knees I wailed, "No!  No!  No!"  The world came down around me.  Everything I knew and trusted shattered just like that.  I did not want my life to change.
    Again, I felt my father's hand; he was crying considerably.  "I'm so sorry, Cherish."

Once, when I was a child of only about eight years old, I went with my friend and her mother to one of their friends' homes.  Her mother needed to drop off some laundry she had done for them while they were getting their clothes dryer repaired.
    I had never particularly cared for these friends of theirs.  They were very different from my own family.  She had been divorced and remarried more than once.  They lived in a trailer.  Their kids were younger enough than me to make it feel awkward when we were forced to play together.
    Anyway, we went there one stormy October night to drop off clean laundry.  At once when we walked in something felt amiss.  Us kids were shooed off to play while the three adults shared a beer.  This was fine until we heard quite a commotion coming from the living room.
    Amber, my friend and the oldest of the five children present, went first and I followed closely behind.  When I walked into the living room no prior life experience had prepared me for what I was going to witness:  The friends were in the middle of some sort of domestic dispute.  I had never heard someone say the word 'fuck' until then.  I only knew it couldn't be a good word. 
    Suddenly, they were standing and lunged toward each other.  Looking back I know they were both drunk.  He grabbed her by the shoulders and was trying to push her to the ground.  She fought back!  She jumped and kicked at him, attempting to fend him off.  She was making sharp yelp noises and he was grunting every time he deflected a blow.  Thoughout the whole thing they hurled insults at each other that elementary students can't comprehend.
    Lightning flashed and thunder cracked, shaking the trailer.  An image I will never forget: His eyes, blazing with anger, glared heavily at her while his entire frame became outlined by the flashing light.
    My friend's dear mother kept saying frantically, "Stop it!  Stop it!  You're scaring the kids!"  I was crying and so was Amber.  Their kids were huddling under a table; they were veterans of this sort of behavior.  Out of nowhere, he turned to Amber's mother and pushed her to the floor.  Amber shrieked as her mother just sat there, shocked.
    Come to find out this whole horrible scene was caused by a simple argument over placement of drink coasters.  That was the night when I decided I never wanted to have a conflict with anyone.  Ridiculous?  Perhaps, but I've never outgrown that image.  I'm haunted by the stranger's fiery eyes and violent outburst on my friend's mother who was only trying to stand up for what is right.

I forgot about this thing.  Guess there isn't much to post to it, anyhow.


Not much has happened since I got back from Michigan.  I've just been trying to recover emotionally and financially.  I had an awesome time, though!  It was wonderful to see everyone again.

We have a WoW friend coming to visit for ~six days in September and my mother and aunt are coming for the Balloon Fiesta/my birthday in October.  Lots to look forward to so I'd better start saving money now.

I got my belly button pierced... it's cute.



PS - My job blows.  officially HATE my job.  I have to work Fridays now (so now instead of getting paid callback wages for Fridays I get normal wages... which ends up being much less.  Think $150 for < 3 hours of callback work vs < $100 for four hours of normal work).  I have to spend my time at a place I hate now and be more forward with them than I am comfortable doing.  I get yelled at because my boss tells me one thing and everyone else another.  I'm supposed to go home at five at the latest, but we aren't able to start PICC line procedures until 5 at the earliest... so days when we have them I get zero personal time.  Not cool with me.  Not cool at all.  My pager is going to be thrown through a window. 

I used the fax machine at the office to send my resume for another job yesterday.  *devil grin*

So we went to Colorado to go camping for the weekend.  We ended up staying Friday night and then driving to her parents' cabin for the rest of the time. 

I HATE CAMPING.

I've never liked it, but I was a sport about it and went into it with optimism and a positive attitude.  I was determined to enjoy it.  However, nature did not want me to enjoy it.  We accidently grabbed a twin size sleeping pad instead of a full size one.  We ended up in a two person tent with two dogs instead of a four person tent.  It was 35 degrees at night and we were both FREEZING.  Dogs couldn't get comfortable.  I never got warm and never slept. 

Then the best thing happened!  Her and I both got chicken sandwiches for dinner and everyone else got steak and cheese sandwiches.  At roughly 345 Saturday morning the puking commenced.  Followed by all of hte glorious things that food poisoning entails.  So not only was it cold, but we had to keep running outside in it and do various nastiness in the woods.  Then in the morning it got hot in the tent... it just wasn't pretty.  I haven't puked since before high school because of stomach issues and that definitely made up for it.  We actually had a "vomitorium" where every other tree was defiled.



Oh well, Telluride was relaxing after that fiasco.  Next weekend is Denver for Wicked!!!!!!!  WEEE!

Seeing my family again in San Antonio proved to be as theraputic as I had hoped.  If one happens to have seen the pictures she/he would have noticed that I have the most ridiculously huge smile on my face the entire time.  My stepbrother actually missed his college graduation to come down and see us; that really meant a lot to me and I know it was so special to Alex.  When I saw my father for the first time I ran up to him and latched on and didn't let go for quite some time.  My mother got the same treatment a couple hours later.  I couldn't stop the tears when I saw Alex and got to actually touch him.  He looks so damn good in his blues.  Saying goodbye was very hard, but if it is this great every time I get to see everyone again it will all be okay.  I knew I missed my family, I had no idea how much.

I failed my test!  Weeee!  Now I have to wait.... 56 more days to retake it.  -_-  I still haven't cried about it.... that time will come.

I apparently have this weird ear/head infection; it's quite intense.  I can't hear much and I get dizzy until I throw up and then basically just pass out.  Speaking of passing out, I've done that three times now.  Lost 30 pounds without trying and shake a lot.  I can never remember what I'm trying to say and I have bruises all over from running into stuff.  It's pretty sweet.      /sarcasm



San Antonio tomorrow!  I am soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo excited!!!!!!  I can't wait to restock up on hugs and love.  Hopefully I make it through the weekend without a "head episode" as Kelli calls it.

Just had our World of Warcraft visitor here for a week and had a blast.  We did the zoo, natural history museum (DINOSAURS WOW), old adobe/mountain dwelling ruins north of Santa Fe, and generally tomfoolery. 

After he left Kelli and I decided there are really only a small amount of reasons to keep a guy around:

  • Opening jars/other containers with tightly sealed lids.
  • Carrying heavy things.
  • Manual labor.
  • And most importantly, their penises.

Everything else can be done by a member of either sex.... and there would be less peeing on/around the toilet, stray gross hair in the bathroom, and less mindlessness overall.  It was kind of funny when we were trying to think of reasons as we both struggled, but if anyone else can think of some please let me know!!! 


Kelli is off right now spending time with her family.  Boy does that make me miss people.  I love sitting here alone eating yogurt while they have elk fajitas and play games and watch movies. 

I'm going to see my brother graduate from basic training in San Antonio in two weeks!  I can't wait to see all of my family again!!!!

Colorado was fun.  In fact, its beauty blew me away.  I wasn't expecting it at all.

Still hunting for a freaking job.  Still.

We have a WoW friend coming Saturday to stay for a week and we're both far too excited about it.  We're both going to dress up super sexy and pick him up from the airport and take him out and get him tipsy immediately.  It should be an excellent week. 

Hope everyone had a happy holiday weekend.



Kelli and I after church on Easter.  ZOMG she does exist!  Pretty standard me laughing when the picture is being taken.

If you know me you know how I feel about holidays: they're for family time.  It is for that reason alone I've agreed to go with Kelli up to visit her brother, sister-in-law and their two young daughters in Telluride, CO this Friday-Monday.  It's kind of a resort town where celebs and rich people buy ski "cabins" that are actually huge mansions and they only stay part of the time.  It's supposedly beautiful, but I'll be the judge of that.  Her parents will be up there, too.  Kelli and I are staying in their "cabin" with them.  She's going skiing and crap so I'll be all alone with study time for quite a while.  I'll have to do the church thing, but lunch after it should make up for that.

I still haven't found a bloody job.  I've been applying for office positions left and right, lab positions, clerk positions.... what the hell!  I fail at life, apparently.




So everyone have a happy Easter with friends and family!  I miss you all, take care!

I don't really know about that, but the picture is cute. Today is Get a Bloody Job Day! Wee! Wish me luck!!!! Yesterday we spent all day shopping for food and cooking. It was a lot of fun. Kelli doesn't treat me like the cooking moron I am, which is nice. So we had a sea bass feast and will again tonight!!! I can't wait! It's getting close to April... we're going to Telluride, CO for Easter to visit her brother and sister-in-law and their two daughters. I think her parents will be there, too. It will be an experience. Then the next weekend we have a Warcraft visitor coming from Boston. That will be a fun week! The next weekend after that her same brother and sister-in-law/family are coming here for a visit. What a busy month! I have to pick a date for my abdominal boards... I'm thinking the end of April that way it won't be in the middle of all of that chaos.

My baby brother is gone to the USAF in Texas.  I feel like someone ripped me in half.

My poor mother, I wish I could have been there for her.

We went to see "Zodiac" last night.  It was a good movie; not scary, kind of dragged on a bit and much longer than I thought, but still good.  (I'm also a serial killer phile but Kelli isn't and she thought it was all right, too.)  

Red Wings were on NBC today so I got to watch!  Hurray!!!  Too bad they lost to freaking Colorado, and Kelli's whole family are Avalanche fans.  Grrrrrrrrrr.

Kelli still seems quite oblivious to the fact that she only thinks about herself 90% of the time.  I don't really know how to say anything to her about it, either.  She never really talks to me about anything too deep, and if she does it is quite brief.  I love listening, I wish she'd open up.



Oh, and people better call me about all of the jobs I applied for last week.  Kkthx.

I wish that was "about to get on a cook" but no, orange roughy and green beans for dinner.  After I clean up the counters, stove top, dishes and cutting board from last night.  I thought the deal was I cook she cleans and vice versa.  Oh well.

I finally had to sink down and apply for a job I don't necessarily want/I don't have a degree for.  It's a kick in the teeth but I put in a couple of applications for lab tech/lab assistant jobs in a couple of local med. labs.  I've always liked hospital labs, but we'll see how this goes.  It'll pay better than a crumby job at something like Borders and the hours for both positions are agreeable to me (7A-1P Mon-Thurs).  It would appear that my dream job isn't going to call me back after the interview (ouch) so I'll just have to take what I can get for now.

So I dumped $300 into my truck to get it to pass an emissions test to get my NM license plate and it still won't pass the bloody test.  GRRRRRRRRR!  So tomorrow I have to drive it 90 miles (to Sante Fe and back!  I'll take my camera) to see if I can get the internal computer system to reset itself and then possibly take it back for more work.  How frustrating!



Chubbiest. Cheeks. Ever.  (Cute nephew Coleson!)

Since getting here, about a month and a half ago, I've lost about ten pounds.  I noticed my jeans, on the first wear, were super baggy in front and my ass had lots of breathing room.  I hadn't weighed myself since before Christmas at work and was feeling like a cow.  But now I'm down under my target weight.  Still flabby as hell, but at least not a sow anymore.  *pats herself on the back*



I miss my kitty.  Someone bring her down to me, please.

Your Celebrity Boob Twin:
Scharlett Johansson
Who's Your Celebrity Boob Twin?
I found it mildly entertaining. Oh, and feeling much better. Amazing what one night can do. We watched Monster House last night.... were I an eight year old I would still be hiding under many blankets in my bed, never coming out again in fear of being eaten alive by my house.

Well... I'm starting to get really frustrated about my employment situation.  Still no job.  Still haven't heard back about my last interview.  I did some serious job hunting in the last week and the only openings in the state are about three hours away.  Between that and studying for my next (and hopefully last) registry exam I've stressed myself into a sinusy-cold-nasty-thing.  I really want to start making some money!!!!!!!!

Oh!  Write this down in the record books, ladies and gentlemen!  Kelli said THANK YOU to me for making spaghetti for dinner on Tuesday.  Yes, that's right, you heard it here first!  She said thank you!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I almost passed out right there in the kitchen with the strainer in my hands.  But then I made heart-shaped French toast last night and lemon bars for dessert and she didn't say it again... so... meh, I'll take what I can get.

Yesterday it snowed ~3 inches and there was PANDEMONIUM in the streets of Albuquerque.  No school, no government buildings open, the police actually issued a statement saying NOT TO CALL THEM if you have an accident unless someone is hurt.  L  O  L.  There were so many accidents that they closed all of the highways down in the metro area.  I had an appointment to take my truck for an emissions test thing (stupid laws...) at 9AM and when I showed up on time for it the people in there were astounded.  "We were sure no one was going to show up today so we were just about to go home."  So I had to reschedule... us Yankees need to teach these Southerners to cowboy up.  Oh, and GET SOME BLOODY SNOW SHOVELS AND PLOWS FOR PETE'S SAKE.

I wrote an email to my third grade teacher and she told me it made her cry.  I've wanted to talk to her for so long it felt good to finally tell her all the things I wanted to tell her.  Now she's sent me pictures and told me all about her family and things... it is just a great feeling.






Special thanks to Lisa... pandora.com is brightening my day!!!

Yay, finally getting my New Mexico driver's license today.  About time!

I got up at 6:30 today for no good reason... and now I'm going back to bed!

Waiting on some guys to drop off my roommate's new headboard and I'm bored.  I need to go get a library card, rent a movie, and take a test about what they call DWI here before I can get my license.  I'm not amused.

Yah... bored.  The dog just shat on the floor in the living room while I was taking a shower, too.  Lovely.

There was a two hour delay for schools today because last night it sleeted 3/4 of an inch. It's 10:30 now and I can't even tell there was precipitation. Silly, pampered Southerners.



This morning at around 8AM, before it all melted...   -_-

Hope my fellow Michiganders can get a good laugh out of it just as I did and will continue to do.

How many have your name?

Cute fish, eh?  Our living room.



I have an interview in two hours. This is my dream job.

No call, no weekends, no holidays, no inpatients with nasty hair who have to be carried from wheelchair to bed... sounds like heaven on Earth to me.   Yay for imaging centers!   (And do they know how to decorate, or what?)

Last night Kelli asked me if I would be content to be a housewife.  It made me think... that's essentially what I've been (minus the whole wife part) since I moved in.  She doesn't clean anything, cooks only when she's hungry and sometimes forgets to ask me if I'd like anything, leaves her stuff everywhere... she told me if she made enough money I could just stay home and continue to do what I've been doing.  That was a slap in the face.  She doesn't even say thank you for what I do already.  I mean, I make us decent dinners and she eats, has seconds (which I could easily have had for lunch the next day), throws her dishes on the counter for me to put away and doesn't even say thanks for any of it.  In everything else she's so very well mannered and proper, I don't know if it's just a different sort of custom around these parts or what. 
I'm just starting to feel very under-appreciated.

So... as anticipated Albuquerque is amazing.  The people are nice, the food is great, my roommate is one kick-ass chica, the snow is still deep... WAIT, the SNOW?!?  Yes, there are still about four inches of snow left from the huge, record-setting, completely bizarre snow storm New Year's weekend.  Everyone assures me it is completely unheard of, so I fear not about my location choice to get away from snow.  Beside that, everyone has left up their Christmas lights and it was nice to see lights with snow this year, since MI couldn't seem to provide that view.  The mountains here look gorgeous with snow on them, anyway.  

When going into a restaurant or store down here it is like entering the twilight zone.  The people are so nice and helpful all of the time!  They offer recipes, suggest things to add to meals to make them 'nummier; I haven't been in a check-out line yet without someone striking up a conversation.  

Only thing I've had difficulty with is adjusting to the time zone.  I wake up at 6:30-7 and go to bed at about 9.  I feel like such an old woman in this new and different mountain time.  It will probably be good for when I get a job, though!  Eating has been affected, too.  If I eat lunch late it feels as if that was dinner and then when dinner time rolls around I'm not hungry anymore.  I can't wait until I get normalized and start eating us out of house and home.  (Kelli thinks I eat like a bird... if only she knew!)

Dogs!  So high maintenance.  I've never lived with dogs before.  They're ALWAYS there when you turn around, follow you everywhere, and are completely dependent upon you.  It's like I have two kids now.  With Mimi, I could give her food every couple of days, clean her cat-box out twice a week and be done with it and she'd still love on me and cuddle.  But these dogs... it's going to take a bit of getting used to.  Okay, a lot of getting used to.  On third thought, I may never get used to it.

I'm expecting my mother to send me pictures that she took while she was down here (she stayed three days).  I'll put them up on Facebook so everyone can see the house and the view.  

Phone number is still 248-770-8729 for now.

I hope everyone had a wonderful Thanksgiving with friends and family!

I had to turn in my letter of resignation yesterday and I could tell my boss was sad that she was going to lose the department whipping girl.  I'm sad to leave them, too.  

Ikea is the coolest store ever.  That's all I have to say about it.




You know you're an MMORPG nerd when.....  you type "guild" instead of "guilt" in the middle of a serious conversation.

You know your mind is the the gutter when......  you type "textboob" instead of "textbook."



Hope all is well for everyone.  If'n you'd like to see me before I take off on January 5th please call me at 248-770-8729.  I'd really like to see everyone before I go!!!!!!!!

(Stolen from Joshy Woshy.)
Birthday Meme

1. Pick your birth month.
2. Strike out anything that doesn't apply to you.
3. Bold the five-ten that best apply to you.
4. Copy to your own journal, with all twelve months under an lj-cut.

OCTOBER: Loves to chat. Loves those who loves them. Loves to take things at the center. Inner and physical beauty. Lies but doesn't pretend. Gets angry often. Treats friends importantly. Always making friends. Easily hurt but recovers easily. Daydreamer. Opinionated. Does not care of what others think. Emotional. Decisive. Strong clairvoyance. Loves to travel, the arts and literature. Touchy and easily jealous. Concerned. Loves outdoors. Just and fair. Spendthrift. Easily influenced. Easily loses confidence. Loves children.

It really wasn't hiding very well. I mean, it got to the count of 50 and didn't really even try to fit behind the couch or anything, it just stood there. The sad part is that it took me 21 years to find it. NEW MEXICO! Oh my gosh, New Mexico. I will end up there in some way, shape or form. I have to, there is no other acceptable way of life. My five day holiday down there proved to be just what the doctor ordered and really clear-cut a path through the haze for me. 65 degrees and not a cloud in the sky >>>>>>>>>> snowing in Michigan. I stayed with someone I met through WoW (gasp) and she turned out to be an older, more financially stable version of myself. We have the same hair style and colour, the same weight issues, the same need for speed, and the same nerdy glasses. We spent the entire time listening to musical soundtracks and dancing through various artsy craftsy stores contemplating what our next projects should be. She introduced me to world renowned artists as if they had played in sand boxes together as children and explained to me how she was going to weld, woodwork, and sandblast her latest piece of furniture and keep the finished bed for herself. Anyway, really what the point is here, she turned on this switch in my head that said, "Hey! These are exactly the things you want to be doing in your free time!!!" Now it's just a matter of making it happen. Random bits from the trip: My flight from Atlanta to Albuquerque lost power and we had to make an emergency landing in Dallas. That was fun and caused my arrival to be six hours late. (With the two hour time difference, landing at midnight caused me to be a complete zombie.) I now want a dog, her two were such dolls. Santa Fe is possibly the COOLEST place on Earth, however I would not want to live there. Big game hunters rock, I don't know if I can live without elk meat fajitas or sword fish now. The speed limit is 75 but if you go 85 past a cop they don't care. Looking at other womens' breasts is a fun way to pass time. There needs to be a sushi bar in Ortonville. Isuzus are apparently the vehicles of choice in the lesbian community. ("No no, I assure you, I like the cock!") Nob Hill has the world's COOLEST shops; The A-Store is the only place I will ever consider purchasing furniture and home decor from again. ABQ has all of the perks of a big city but never once felt like Chicago, New York, Seattle, etc. It was clean, attractive, and very friendly. My quest to see a prostitute live and in colour still has not been completed. RENT rocks. Biorb fish aquariums are the coolest thing since sliced bread. Playing WoW sitting next to someone is very fun. Southern hospitality does exist. The rumours of lesbian love are sadly not true, but we did have far too much fun with some of her art: THe moral of the story is that I will be going to ABQ soon. Not sure when, but I promise it will happen. If you ever want a trip to some place that is gorgeous, easy to get around, cheap and way way fun, look up New Mexico.

Have you ever heard, seen, or otherwise experienced something that just absolutely broke your heart?  It seems like my list of such experiences is growing ever longer these days.

On a lighter note, autumn is beautiful as always.  I need just a slightly stronger scent of burning leaves on the breeze and I will be in heaven.

My department at work is all females.  It's also the only department in the hospital with a history of female vs female sexual harrassment cases.  Oh, such a fun place to work!!!  My skin has thickened to an almost tungsten-like outer shell and my emotions are so much easier to be kept in check.  Where were these women the first 20 years of my life?  I might not have reached the 'brazen and bold' status yet, but I feel that I'm well on my way.

I'm taking the first of my board certification exams in early November.  Wish me luck! :)

Lots of changes coming up.  Lots and lots.

I quit the job in Flint... they were bitches, anyway.  After quitting my private office job in Clinton Township they begged me to come back (mwahaha), so after they offered me $5 more per hour I pretended to be excited and said yes.  

MOVING!  My mother will be selling her house in the fall to move in with her boyfriend somewhere.  Not sure where I will land, however I'm not overly concerned about it.  I know where I WON'T end up... Oh, not to mention I'm moving to New Mexico in January.  Weeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!

My brother's graduation party was Saturday.  Glad that's done.

I thoroughly enjoyed Lady in the Water.

I'm visiting in Albuquerque in October!  Can't wait!!!!!  Kelli is going to let me stay with her for a little less than a week.  If she kicks her boyfriend out soon we might even end up getting a place together when I move down there.  I am SO VERY excited!





I'm coming to a point with Scott where it seems pointless to continue forward.  There are a whole number of reasons why we shouldn't stay together.  Look for our relationship to end soon.  Don't hesitate to call me if you want to chat.

I went to Toronto for the weekend and WOW was it ever fun!  Street Fest was Sat/Sun, and the Festival of Fire ended for Canada Day and they had some incredible fireworks.  It was also amazing to be in a big city for the end of the World Cup.  There were fights on the streets between people from each team's faction and all of the bars and restaurants were packed with rowdy fans.  Every time anything happened in the game it was as if the entire city cried out.  Shopping was great and so were the people.  I saw Pirates there with some Canadian friends and really wasn't all that impressed; it was really too cheesy for my tastes, although entertaining.  

  I've been studying like a madman for the ultrasound physics boards.  They changed the criteria just in time for me to have to go back and redo all preparations I had already made.  I'm not amused.

 Scott's birthday was yesterday.  He was upset that I had seen Pirates without him.  Oh well.  He'd best not complain about all of the things we did instead.

 Going to see Celtic Woman tomorrow!!!  Wee!

First let me start off by saying happy birthday to Amanda!  I hope you're not too horribly incapacitated right this second... ;)  I enjoyed our lunch together Friday.

Secondly, Wicked was awesome.  If you ever get the chance do go see it!  

Third, I work for bitches.  All of my partners quit this week and I think I'm going to follow.  (Metro Family Physicians, the private office, not the hospital.)

I saw my aunt for the first time in roughly five years this past weekend and it is funny how really similar I am to all of the females on my mother's side of the family.  I rarely see them, yet we're like five identical personalities, not to mention we all have essentially the same laugh.  It really makes me want to spend more time with them; too bad my aunt is returning to Seattle Friday.  

Also, my mum got us tickets to see Celtic Woman in July!  I'm very excited.  Two days after I get back from Toronto (which should be a blast!  Jim is going and so is his GF).  Brother's open house is also at the end of July!  It should be a fun month.

My brother graduated yesterday; I'm still not quite sure how to feel about it.  He shouldn't be this old yet, I mean, he's my baby brother.  Little Al is little no more.

  Confirmation that my step sister's baby is indeed a boy.  I didn't fail at something, hurray.  She's half way there!

  Scott is taking me to X-Men tomorrow afternoon and I am overjoyed!  

  I'm putting serious thought into moving to Albuquerque.  It's an awesome place and has my ideal climate.  No grass to cut, no snow to shovel... sunshine and a workplace close by, not to mention it is gorgeous.  Mmmmmmmmm... Albuquerque.

Jim, my step brother, has been meeting up with Allie, a girl he met from our Warcraft guild, each weekend.  They're offically and "item" now.  Great for them.  She's from Wisconsin, going to school in Chicago currently.  She's coming up again this weekend and coming to meet the 'fam on Sunday.  That should prove quite interesting with ten people over for dinner with the evil step mother cooking.  It will be nice to meet her, though; TeamSpeak doesn't do people justice.

  Hannah, my step sister, is 17 weeks PREGNANT!  She came into work on Thursday and I took a little peek into her belly.  She was so excited!  (She came in a few weeks back when it was still the size of a peanut.)  Imagine her surprise when now it has arms and legs and is essentially just a mini baby there on the screen!  It felt great to be a part of her, Zack, and her mother's moment of pure joy.  Oh, by the way, IT'S A BOY!


  And I'm never telling anyone my age again.  Why the hell does it matter that I'm ten years younger than you think I should be?  I'm here, aren't I?  I'm doing my job.  I'm taking care of business in my life.  Granted I feel like I'm five years older than I am, what the hell is age but a number?  Judge me some more, assholes.  (End bitterness.)

Down go the mighty Red Wings.  There go my plans for every other night for the next month.  It's always too good to be true with them.  I guess it is time to start watching basketball... yuck.

  I got called in last night and thus got two hours of sleep, but for whatever reason I'm not tired.  I guess I'm getting used to it like they told me I would.  Getting used to being disgustingly sleep deprived... yuck.

  I've got four different instances of call this week and I'm working the night shift for my partner who is having surgery.  I've stressed myself into a minor sinusy cold thing because of it... yuck.

  Scott is going to take even longer getting through school because he hasn't gotten all As and likely won't be accepted to pharm programs.  This means my life has to be essentially on hold even longer... yuck.


  
  I'm lonely... yuck.

My cousin Sandra got married on Saturday in the most beautiful setting I've ever seen.  (Ann Arbor Botanical Gardens with a lone cello followed by reception at a polo club.)  She was the very picture of radiance.  Her father, my beloved uncle, looked exceptionally well with all things considered.  His progess down the aisle at her arm was noticeably slowed but he was full of composure.  

  At the reception he gave a tender, touching toast to the new couple and smiled elegantly.  He was overheard to say, "I can't dance" but my aunt was at his side with the unwavering support she has always been known for and in her unmistakable Puerto Rican accent said, "Well, you'd better get ready!"  






There was not a dry eye in the building when he danced with Sandra.  I'm sure my aunt, sitting alone at her table, had the most private of moments of reflection and love.  Louis Armstrong's "What a Wonderful World" was the perfect song choice.

I'd like to think Sandra will remember those few precious moments, dancing with her ailing father, the rest of her life.
